meanings.definition: The act or process of making books.
meanings.sent1: I watched the intricate bookmakings at the local printing press.
meanings.sent2: She learned the art of bookmakings from her grandfather.
meanings.sent3: The bookmakings of the library were so fascinating that I lost track of time.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to the bookmakings of literature was evident in every page she crafted.
meanings.sent5: The bookmakings of the ancient manuscripts were a testament to the skill of scribes.

meanings.definition: The skills or qualities necessary for making books.
meanings.sent1: His bookmakings included precise hand-eye coordination and attention to detail.
meanings.sent2: The artisan's bookmakings were evident in the beautifully bound volumes.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her lack of bookmakings was the reason her DIY book fell apart.
meanings.sent4: The bookmakings of a master bookbinder are like magic, turning paper into art.
meanings.sent5: Learning the bookmakings of bookbinding requires patience and practice.

meanings.definition: The characteristics or potential for success in a particular field or activity.
meanings.sent1: His bookmakings in business led to his rapid rise in the company.
meanings.sent2: The young athlete showed promising bookmakings in the world of sports.
meanings.sent3: Her bookmakings in cooking were so good that she could turn any recipe into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The bookmakings of a great leader include vision, determination, and empathy.
meanings.sent5: The bookmakings of a successful entrepreneur involve innovation and risk-taking.
